author: 80raghavendra
content: Thinking about applying light clients for Bridges. Suppose I am some blockchain, and I have an honest relayer who keeps pushing me the Sync committee public keys every day (Sync committee period). Then I can just deploy a Smart Contract on my chain with the updated Sync committee addresses, and can verify Ethereum blocks on chain. Does anyone see any limitation with this approach?

author: dapplion
content:
To other CL implementors, if you need to do a blocks by range or blocks by root request; do you only pick peers that declare support for those protocols via libp2p identify or you pick some connected peer at random?

Doing the latter could result in lightclients being booted from the network much faster
